definitions.definition: Moving or operating quickly, as a train not making local stops.
Specific or precise ; directly and distinctly stated; not merely implied .
examples: I gave him express instructions not to begin until I arrived, but he ignored me.
This book cannot be copied without the express permission of the publisher.
In my eyes it bore a livelier image of the spirit, it seemed more express and single, than the imperfect and divided countenance.

definitions.definition: Providing a more limited but presumably faster service than a full or complete dealer of the same kind or type.

main_definition: ( not comparable ) Moving or operating quickly, as a train not making local stops.
secondary_definitions: ( comparable ) Specific or precise ; directly and distinctly stated; not merely implied .
( postpositive , retail ) Providing a more limited but presumably faster service than a full or complete dealer of the same kind or type.
